results.title: I was there
results.creator_credit: Kristian Ryhammer, Central Film O and Teamfilm AS
results.brief_description: A survey of the modern integrated transport system in Norway - a rail ticket entitles you to travel by train, boat or bus and you may break your journey when and where you like. Shows the modern cities, historic buildings, old fishing villages and the spectacular scenery. (Awards: Lisboa)

results.title: I don't have to hide
results.brief_description: The filmmaker examines her own history of anorexia nervosa and bulimia, and compares her case with others.

results.title: I am here today (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A record of how 21 children aged 5, 6 and 7 interacted with each other as they made various things in the playroom. The children were from the same class, growing and changing together in the classroom since the previous September. Filmed in May 1969. A film study for teachers.

results.title: I'm seventeen, I'm pregnant and I don't know what to do
results.creator_credit: David Crommie and Lee Mendelson Film Productions
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the plight of an unwed pregnant adolescent. With her parents, social workers and a discussion group at the Children’s Home Society of California, she considers the alternatives of abortion, forced marriage, temporary foster care, keeping the baby or relinquishing it for adoption.

results.brief_description: Cut-outs and flip cards made by children between the ages of 9 and 13 for the White House Conference on Children are assembled here on the subjects of health, learning, environment, laws, rights and responsibilities, individuality, parents and families.

results.title: I'll quit tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Gerald T Rogers and GTR Productions
results.brief_description: Tells what happened to Steve Miller and his family as he develops the illness of alcoholism. Shows how it was arrested by a successful intervention by the family and employer.

results.title: Hyper >> [games magazine] Issue 94, August 2001
results.creator_credit: Eliot Fish, Stuart Clarke and Next Publishing
results.brief_description:
Hyper was a multi-platform Australian video game magazine. It was Australia’s longest running gaming magazine, published from 1993 to 2019.

In addition to coverage of current major video game systems and game releases, Hyper also covered anime, DVD movies, arcade and classic games, and featured interviews with industry professionals and articles on game-related content such as game classifications, computer hardware and video game music. Hyper also had a sister magazine, the PC gaming oriented PC PowerPlay. (citation from Wikipedia).

A digital version of the magazine can be found here: https://archive.org/details/hyper-094
